battleship

Class Ship

  • java.lang.Object
    • battleship.Ship
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Battleship, Cruiser, Destroyer, EmptySea, Submarine

    public abstract class Ship
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a Ship in the game.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int bowColumn
      The column that contains the bow (front part of the ship).
      private int bowRow
      The row that contains the bow (front part of the ship).
      private boolean[] hit
      An array of 4 booleans that indicate whether that part of the ship has been hit or not.
      private boolean horizontal
      A boolean that represents whether the ship is going to be placed horizontally or vertically.
      private int length
      The length of the ship.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Ship(int length)
      Default constructor that sets the length property of the particular ship and initializes the hit array.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Ship

        public Ship(int length)
        Default constructor that sets the length property of the particular ship and initializes the hit array. Index 0 refers to the bow.
        Parameters:
        length - The length of the ship.

      • isShipAdjacent

        boolean isShipAdjacent(int row,
                       int column,
                       Ship[][] ships)
        Determines whether a ship is adjacent to the given tile given by the row/column.
        Parameters:
        row - The row that contains the bow.
        column - The column that contains the bow.
        ships - The 10x10 array representing an "ocean".
        Returns:
        boolean indicating whether the tile has a ship adjacent to it.

      • okToPlaceShipAt

        boolean okToPlaceShipAt(int row,
                        int column,
                        boolean horizontal,
                        Ocean ocean)
        Determines whether it is okay to put a ship of this length with its bow in this location. The ship must not overlap or touch another ship and it must not �stick out� beyond the Ocean array.
        Parameters:
        row - The row that contains the bow.
        column - The column that contains the bow.
        horizontal - Whether the ship is horizontal or vertical.
        ocean - The 10x10 array representing an "ocean".
        Returns:
        Boolean indicating if it is okay to put a ship of this length with its bow in this location.

      • placeShipAt

        void placeShipAt(int row,
                 int column,
                 boolean horizontal,
                 Ocean ocean)
        "Puts" the ship in the ocean. Values are assigned to the bowRow, bowColumn, and horizontal instance variables. Puts a reference to the ship in each of 1 or more locations (up to 4) in the ships array in the Ocean object. Horizontal ships face East (bow at right end) and vertical ships face South (bow at bottom end).
        Parameters:
        row - The row that contains the bow.
        column - The column that contains the bow.
        horizontal - Whether the ship is horizontal or vertical.
        ocean - The 10x10 array representing an "ocean".

      • shootAt

        boolean shootAt(int row,
                int column)
        If a part of the ship occupies the given row and column, and the ship hasn�t been sunk, marks that part of the ship as �hit�.
        Parameters:
        row - The row that contains the bow.
        column - The column that contains the bow.
        Returns:
        Boolean indicating whether the ship has been hit.

      • isSunk

        boolean isSunk()
        Determines whether every part of the ship has been hit.
        Returns:
        Boolean indicating whether every part of the ship has been hit.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides default toString() function. Returns a single-character String to use in the Ocean's print method.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        "s" if the ship has been sunk and "x" if it has not been sunk.
